DOC.brief_summary: Transfusion of stored blood has been associated with increased pulmonary vascular resistance in lambs. The investigators hypothesize that transfusion of one unit of red blood cells stored under standard conditions in intensive care patients will increase pulmonary arterial pressure and pulmonary vascular resistance to a greater extent than will one unit of fresh red blood cells.
DOC.brief_title: Hemodynamic Effects of Stored Blood Transfusion in Intensive Care Patients
DOC.criteria: 1. The patient has a pulmonary artery catheter in place 2. Transfusion of 1 unit of packed red blood cells indicated for standard intensive care therapy 3. The patient has an arterial catheter 1. Age < 18 years 2. Clinical prediction that the patient will not survive at least 48 hours 3. Acute bleeding: > 2 units of packed red blood cells/hour 4.
